title: HR SM use case: Request an eLetter for a business visa
content:
In order to apply for a business visa, Pete, an employee, needs his HR department to provide him with a letter that confirms his employment and purpose of travel. In order to do this, he must draft an eLetter using a template provided by HR, obtain approval from his manager, and then upload his draft to a secure folder so that HR can validate it and have it signed or stamped. 

This use case demonstrates how employee files can be stored and viewed through integrations to OpenText content management platforms.

The following personas are involved in this use case.

Persona Responsibilities
Pete - Employee Initiates the request and completes the template letter.

Paul - Manager

 Approves the request.

Eve - HR agent

 Creates a secure folder in which to store documents related to this request, and has the completed letter signed or stamped.

Prerequisites

  • You must have deployed the HR Content package. The package contains the Request eLetter for business visa (Related Documents integration configured) service offering that is required to fulfill Pete's request.

    For more information about how to deploy content packages for Service Management, see Content.

  • You must have set up an integration with OpenText Extended ECM (xECM) or OpenText Core Content to embed the xECM or Core Content widget in the Related documents tab of records.

    For more information about how to do this, see Integrate with Extended ECM and Integrate with Core Content.

  • You must have created a generally-available folder in either xECM or Core Content that contains template eLetters. 

Configure the offering

  1. Log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin, navigate to Plan > Service Catalog > Travel and Time Off > Travel, and then select the Request Remote Country Work Agreement (Related Documents integration configured) service offering.
  2. Add the link to the shared folder that contains the eLetter templates to the offering description. This folder must be accessible to all employees that may need to request an eLetter based on one of the templates.

Use case

Step 1: Employee requests eLetter

Persona
Pete - Employee

Pete logs in to the Service Portal, where he knows he can have access to a variety of self service support features, such as catalog, knowledge, and subscription management for the applications he uses every day.

Pete selects the Travel and Time Off catalog, and then requests the Request eLetter for business visa (Related Documents integration configured) service offering.

He clicks the link in the offering description, and is taken to a shared folder on xECM from where he downloads the appropriate template letter.

Back in Service Portal, he enters the required information to the request, including:

  • The business justification for the request
  • The purpose of his travel
  • His travel destination
  • His date of departure
  • His return date
  • His citizenship
  • Any specific information that is required in the letter

When he has entered all the information, Pete clicks Submit, and a request is created.

Step 2: Manager approval

Persona

Paul - Manager

Paul receives an email notification from Service Management that Pete's request is pending his approval. He clicks the link in the email and is taken to his approval queue. After reviewing the request, Paul clicks Approve.

Step 3: HR creates a shared folder

Persona

Eve - HR agent

Eve is monitoring the HR service request queue, and sees Pete's approved request. She opens xECM and creates a folder in which they can share the private documentation related to this request.

Back in Service Management, Eve opens the Related Documents tab of the request, and adds the node ID of the folder she just created in xECM.

Eve leaves a comment in the request, including a link to the xECM folder and instructions for Pete to upload completed template eLetter to the xECM folder she just created.​

Step 4: Employee completes and uploads eLetter

Persona
Pete - Employee

Pete checks his request in Service Portal and sees Eve's comment.

He adds the required details to the template letter and uploads it to the shared folder in xECM.

Step 5: HR provides formal eLetter

Persona

Eve - HR agent

Pete's eLetter is now visible to Eve in the Related Documents tab of the request.

Eve reviews the updates to the eLetter made by Pete, and then has the eLetter stamped and/or signed according to policy in the country where Pete works. She then uploads the finalized eLetter to the xECM folder, leaves a comment for Pete, and closes the request.
